isis.stitle: HEAT VENTILATION AIR CONDITIONING (HVAC) SYSTEM - ProStar - REMOVE AND INSTALL - A/C HOSE ASSEMBLY - TO REAR HVAC UNIT

svcproc.title: A/C HOSE ASSEMBLY - TO REAR HVAC UNIT

step1.para: Discharge A/C system. Refer to DISCHARGING THE SYSTEM .
Under the hood, disconnect the A/C line to the rear HVAC unit where it connects to the front A/C line. Plug all open lines ( Figure 46).
If vehicle is equipped with aerodynamic skirts, remove passenger side skirts and panels, as necessary, to gain access to the AC/heater line hangers located under the cab floor.
From under the vehicle, remove the rear AC/heater line hanger ( Figure 48).

note.para: In the following step the threaded stud may unscrew from the TXV body. If so, examine the condition of the stud and the retaining nut. If possible, clean the existing stud and install it into the TXV body. Otherwise, install a new threaded stud. Retain the mounting nut, or replace if necessary.

step1.para: Disconnect the A/C lines from the Thermostatic Expansion Valve (TXV). Retain the lock plate and lock plate retaining nut. Plug all open tubes/ports ( Figure 48).
Remove the front hose hanger and retain the heat shield for use during installation ( Figure 46).

While placing as little strain on the A/C and heater lines as possible, loosen each of the remaining hose hangers enough to remove the A/C line from the hanger ( Figure 47). Leave the hangers connected to provide support for the heater lines.
Remove the disconnected line(s) towards the rear of the cab.

figure.caption: Figure 48. Rear A/C and Heater Line Connections

step1.para: With the ends sealed to prevent contamination, maneuver the new line into position from the rear.
Under the hood; using a new C-plate and lubricated O-ring, connect the new A/C line to the front A/C line 'splice' fitting. Tighten to 19,000 to 21,000 N.mm (170 to 190 lbf-in).
Under the vehicle, position the A/C lines in the 3 middle line hangers. Leave the hangers loose at this time.

note.para: In the following step, keeping the A/C lines free of the hanger allows better alignment with the TXV during installation.

step1.para: Before securing the A/C lines with the rear hanger, connect them to the TXV using new O-rings, the lower lock plate, and the lock plate retaining nut. Tighten to 9,000 to 10,000 N.mm (80 to 90 lbf-in). Refer to Figure 48 and Figure 49.
Install the front hanger, including the heat shield removed earlier. Verify that heater and A/C lines are positioned correctly in hangers, without binding; then tighten hanger bolt ( Figure 46).
Verify that heater and A/C lines are positioned correctly while tightening all remaining hanger bolts ( Figure 47).

Recharge A/C system. Refer to CHARGING THE AIR CONDITIONING SYSTEM
.
